title: Bangladesh's Yunus asked Modi to stop Hasina from speaking - how PM responded
content: Mohammad Yunus, chief advisor to Bangladesh's interim government, revealed at Chatham House that he requested PM Modi to restrain Sheikh Hasina's communications after she sought refuge in India. Yunus expressed concern over alleged fake news from Indian media fueling unease in Bangladesh.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder rerun: UP woman kills husband 18 years after marriage
content: In Siddharthnagar, Sangeeta Devi and her lover, Anil Shukla, were arrested for murdering Sangeeta's husband, Kannan Kumar. Sangeeta poisoned Kannan after a temple visit and, with Anil, threw his body into the Rapti river. She then filed a missing person report, but inconsistencies led to her confession. Kannan's brother had already suspected foul play due to marital issues.

title: Middle East: Is Israel ready to hit Iran's nuclear sites? US braces for fallout
content: Tensions escalate as Israel prepares for a potential military operation against Iran. This move could disrupt diplomacy and trigger regional conflict. US intelligence suggests Iran is nearing nuclear weapon capability. Diplomatic talks are stalling. The US is bracing for Israeli action. Retaliatory strikes against US assets are a concern. Oil markets are reacting to the rising tensions.

title: 52-yr-old school rivalry resurfaces; men in 60s assault Class 4 classmate
content: A decades-old schoolyard fight in Kasaragod has reignited after 52 years, leading to a violent confrontation. Balakrishnan, 62, allegedly attacked his former classmate, V J Babu, over a quarrel from their Class IV days. Babu sustained injuries, including lost teeth, after Balakrishnan and another classmate, Mathew, confronted him.

title: Delhi boils under heatwave: Feels like temperature at 52°C; IMD issues 'red' alert for today
content: Delhi is experiencing a severe heatwave. The temperature felt like 51.9 degrees Celsius. The weather department issued a red alert for Thursday. A yellow alert is in place for Friday. Rain and thunderstorms are expected on Friday. Respite from the heat is anticipated from June 13. Moisture-laden winds from the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea will bring relief.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: ‘Investors from US interested…’: Adani Airport Holdings may raise $1 bn
content: Adani Airport Holdings is contemplating raising $1 billion from global investors, potentially marking its first external equity funding. Valued at $20 billion, surpassing GMR Airport's market capitalization, AAHL manages seven airports and is set to inaugurate its eighth in Navi Mumbai.

title: Punjab shocker: Popular social media influencer Kamal Kaur found dead in car; probe on
content: Kamal Kaur, a well-known Instagram influencer from Ludhiana with over 3.83 lakh followers, was discovered dead in a car near Adesh Medical University in Bathinda on Thursday. Kaur was popular for her reels on Instagram. Police have initiated an investigation into the circumstances surrounding her death.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam eyed as mastermind; Raj just pawn; hunt on for hideout
content: Investigators now suspect Sonam Raghuvanshi, involved in the honeymoon murder case, might be the mastermind, manipulating Raj Kushwaha with promises of love. Raj may have unknowingly facilitated her escape, as Sonam allegedly planned a hideout in Indore. She remained there while searches were conducted, later fleeing to Uttar Pradesh when the plan unraveled.

title: How this one-sentence by Elon Musk made him richer by $191 million
content: Elon Musk's net worth saw a rise. This happened after he apologized to Donald Trump. Musk regretted his social media posts. He had criticized Trump earlier. The apology followed a phone call. Trump acknowledged Musk's statement. The market reacted positively. Musk's wealth increased by $191 million. It reached $411.4 billion.

title: Kerala ship sinking: 16 days on, police file criminal case; blame crew's mishandling for tragedy
content: Following pressure from fishing communities, police have filed a case against the owner, master, and crew of the MSC Elsa 3, which sank off Alappuzha in May. The FIR cites rash navigation and mishandling of hazardous cargo, leading to environmental damage and economic losses. The sunken vessel released hazardous materials, posing a threat to marine ecosystems and navigation.

title: Elon Musk wealth: Net worth rises, after apology to Donald Trump
content: Elon Musk's net worth increased by $191 million after he expressed regret for his harsh comments about Donald Trump. Musk apologized on X, admitting his posts "went too far." Trump acknowledged Musk's message and expressed his appreciation, according to White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt.

title: Long-range precision weapons make geographical barriers irrelevant: Air Marshal Dixit
content: Air Marshal Ashutosh Dixit highlighted India's Operation Sindoor, showcasing the effectiveness of long-range precision strikes that nullify geographical barriers. He emphasized the importance of real-time situational awareness and deep surveillance in modern conflicts.

title: Google offers voluntary exit to these employees; SVP Nick Fox says 'goal is to … '
content: Google has initiated voluntary buyouts in its Core, Search, Ads, and K&I divisions amidst an AI-focused restructuring, announced on June 10, 2025. Senior VP Nick Fox cited the program as a supportive exit for those not aligned with Google's strategy. Simultaneously, a stricter return-to-office policy mandates hybrid schedules for remote employees near Google offices.

title: Project Pelican: Canada busts major drug racket; ISI-backed Khalistan plot suspected
content: Canadian authorities have dismantled a major narco-terror network, dubbed Project Pelican, with alleged ties to Khalistan sympathizers. The operation seized 479 kg of cocaine, valued at $47.9 million, and arrested nine individuals, including seven of Indian origin. Investigations reveal the network used commercial trucking routes from the US, linked to Mexican cartels, to traffic drugs.

title: NEET UG result : Expected announcement date revealed; steps to download scorecards
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) is expected to announce the NEET UG 2025 results soon, following the exam held on May 4. Over 22.7 lakh candidates appeared across 557 cities and 14 foreign centres. Results, along with key performance data and the final answer key, will be available online at neet.nta.nic.in.

title: Who is Dominick McGee? MAGA influencer stirring up outrage on X
content: Dominick McGee, once an obscure online figure, rose to prominence on X through controversial posts, even gaining White House access. He leveraged attention-grabbing tactics, like misgendering Brittney Griner, to boost his visibility. While X's revenue-sharing program initially proved lucrative, earnings became unpredictable.

title: Trump unveils US 'Gold Card' website: Who can apply, eligibility
content: Donald Trump's "Gold Card," offering a path to US citizenship for foreigners investing $5 million, has launched its waiting list. Trump announced the opening via social media, highlighting the immense interest.

title: 3 ways to check for heart blockage at home, without blood test
content: Heart blockage doesn’t always cause pain only in the chest. Sometimes, the pain can spread or radiate to other parts of the upper body. Common areas include the jaw (especially the lower left side), left arm, neck, shoulder, back, or even the upper stomach. This radiating pain happens because the nerves in these areas share pathways with the heart, so the brain interprets the pain signals as coming from these places

title: Paytm shares crash 10% after FinMin’s statement on UPI transactions; here’s what happened
content: Paytm's stock price plummeted by 10% following the finance ministry's denial of plans to introduce Merchant Discount Rate (MDR) on UPI transactions, contradicting earlier media reports. The clarification triggered investor concerns, leading to Paytm's steepest single-day drop since February 2024. Payments Council of India had previously advocated for MDR to sustain digital payments infrastructure.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir discloses how India can have a 'memorable tour'; Gill shares approach
content: Gautam Gambhir, the Indian cricket team's head coach, motivated the squad, including new captain Shubman Gill and debutants, during a pre-series nets session in Beckenham. He emphasised seizing the opportunity to create a memorable tour despite the absence of experienced players - Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and R Ashwin.

title: No trace of newlywed Pratapgarh couple on honeymoon trip to Sikkim
content: A newlywed couple from Pratapgarh, Kaushlendra and Ankita, remain missing after their tourist vehicle plunged into the Teesta River in Sikkim thirteen days ago. The couple, married in May, were on their honeymoon when the accident occurred, leaving their families in distress.

title: Matthew Hayden criticises South Africa's approach against Australia
content: Former Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden criticized South Africa's lack of intent on day one of the WTC final against Australia, highlighting Bavuma's slow start. Sanjay Bangar emphasized Australia's strong position due to early wickets. Despite Smith and Webster's fifties, Rabada's five-wicket haul restricted Australia to 212.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold prices are recovering, trading above a falling channel. Support is seen at ₹96,600, with a target of ₹99,000. Silver has broken resistance at ₹1,01,000 and is targeting ₹1,10,000. Support lies at ₹1,04,000.

title: Jealousy, rivalry over love triangle: Man strangled, body found stuffed in fridge; doctor held
content: In Tripura, a shocking murder case has unfolded with the arrest of six individuals, including a doctor and his parents. Sariful Islam, an electrician, was allegedly murdered in Agartala due to a love triangle involving Dr. Dibakar Saha and a woman.

title: 'They can't have nukes': Why US is pulling troops from parts of Middle East
content: Amid rising tensions and stalled nuclear negotiations, the US is reducing its diplomatic and military presence in the Middle East. The State Department ordered nonessential staff to depart from Baghdad and authorized optional departures from Bahrain and Kuwait. The military is also allowing voluntary departures of dependents as regional instability looms and the IAEA considers censuring Iran.

title: Space menu includes grilled chicken & more; thanks to Indian-origin scientist
content: Indian-origin food scientist Professor Suresh Pillai is revolutionising space cuisine, ensuring astronauts enjoy nutritious and culturally relevant meals. As Shubhanshu Shukla prepares to be the first Indian astronaut on the ISS with Axiom Mission 4, Pillai's work takes center stage. His lab's eBeam technology sterilises food without heat, crucial for long-duration missions. NASA's meticulously crafted Indian-style barramundi fish curry exemplifies this innovation. Shukla will savor home-style Indian dishes alongside standard NASA fare, enhancing well-being in microgravity.

title: Deportation case: Federal judge orders release of Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil
content: A federal judge ordered the release of Mahmoud Khalil, a legal US resident detained after participating in pro-Palestinian demonstrations. The judge cited irreparable harm to Khalil's career and free speech rights due to his detention. Despite the ruling, Khalil will remain in custody pending a possible government appeal, highlighting ongoing legal battles over activism and immigration.

title: Indian-origin man jailed in US; duped senior citizens as 'money mule'
content: Pranav Patel, an Indian-origin man, received a six-year prison sentence for his role in a fraud targeting senior citizens. He laundered $1,791,301, collected from elderly victims across the eastern US, who were deceived by overseas callers posing as US treasury officials. One victim even lost his home due to the scam.

title: New dinosaur species 'Dragon Prince' discovered — what did it look like?
content: Khankhuuluu mongoliensis, or "Dragon Prince," a newly identified tyrannosauroid species, roamed Mongolia 86 million years ago. Initially misidentified, high-tech scans revealed this agile predator, weighing 750 kilos, predates T. rex. This discovery suggests tyrannosaurs possibly originated in Asia, migrated to North America, and then returned, reshaping our understanding of dinosaur evolution and distribution.

title: Kennedy Center: Donald Trump and Melania cheered, booed; watch video
content: President Trump's attendance at the Kennedy Center's 'Les Misérables' opening was met with mixed reactions amidst his efforts to reshape the institution. Accompanied by Melania Trump and GOP allies, his visit coincided with reports of cast boycotts and followed his controversial overhaul of the center's leadership and proposed arts funding cuts.

title: 'Take it or leave it': Trump may extend July 8 tariff deadline
content: Donald Trump indicated flexibility on extending the trade talk deadline. However, he believes it might not be essential. Discussions are ongoing with multiple countries. The US will soon send letters outlining final trade deal terms. A deal with China is reportedly done, pending final approval pending final approval from Trump  and Chinese President Xi Jinping

title: 'I think he became a better cricketer': Sanjana Ganesan on Jasprit Bumrah
content: Sanjana Ganesan revealed that Jasprit Bumrah's cricket has improved since their son Angad's birth, attributing it to a peaceful home life. She also highlighted the unique personalities of cricketers' wives and their complementary roles. Sanjana shared lighthearted moments with Bumrah, noting his attempts to distract her during interviews and their comfortable off-field bond as 'gossip buddies'.

title: 'Within 45 metres': Chinese fighter jets fly close to Japan military aircraft
content: Tokyo has lodged a strong protest with Beijing following a dangerous encounter between Chinese fighter jets and a Japanese patrol plane in the Pacific. The incident, occurring last weekend, involved Chinese jets flying within 45 meters of the Japanese aircraft.

title: 'We know where we want to get to'- Brendon McCullum confident in England’s new bowling unit
content: England's head coach Brendon McCullum expressed excitement about the upcoming five-Test series against India, highlighting the team's varied bowling attack. Despite missing key bowlers, he praised the emerging talent, including spinner Shoaib Bashir. India, embarking on a new era without veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, will begin their WTC cycle. Shubman Gill will be leading the side.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 82,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Thursday, While Nifty50 opened above 25,150, BSE Sensex was above 82,500.

title: Who is Zeeshan Akhtar? Key conspirator in Baba Siddique murder held in Canada; linked to Bishnoi gang
content: Zeeshan Akhtar, accused of involvement in the murder of NCP politician Baba Siddique, has been detained in Canada based on an Interpol notice. Mumbai police are awaiting official confirmation. Akhtar, a 22-year-old from Punjab, is alleged to have been a key conspirator, managing finances and coordinating with other accused linked to the Lawrence and Anmol Bishnoi gang.

title: Maharashtra FYJC general merit list released: Direct download link- what to do next
content: The Maharashtra School Education and Sports Department has released the final general merit list for FYJC Class 11 admissions 2025 on mahafyjcadmissions.in. Following a revised timeline to accommodate grievance redressals, the list marks the beginning of zero-round admissions. Over 20 lakh seats across 9,281 colleges are on offer for Arts, Science, and Commerce streams.

title: Fact-check: Can fruit seeds pose a threat to the appendix?
content: The belief that fruit seeds cause appendicitis is largely a myth. Studies show seeds rarely contribute to the condition. Appendicitis is usually due to blockages or infections. Research indicates foreign objects can affect the appendix. Appendicitis and appendix cancer are distinct. Appendicitis is inflammation, not cancer. Sometimes, appendicitis surgery reveals hidden tumors.

title: WTC Final: History made after 145 years at Lord’s
content: Kagiso Rabada's stunning five-wicket haul helped South Africa dismiss Australia for 212 on Day 1 of the WTC Final at Lord's. However, Australia fought back, leaving South Africa at 43 for 4 at stumps. The day also saw a historic first, with both teams' No. 1 batters dismissed for a duck.

title: I'm still trying to fathom how I've done that' Steve Smith on his dismissal
content: Steve Smith achieved a milestone at Lord's, surpassing batting records. He scored 66 runs during the World Test Championship final. Australia was struggling initially, but Smith's innings stabilized the team. Kagiso Rabada took five wickets, becoming South Africa's leading bowler at Lord's. Both Smith and Rabada shared insights on the pitch conditions.

title: Faridabad family suicide horror: Parathas to plans for outing, calm before tragedy
content: In Faridabad, Manoj Mehto took his four sons to railway tracks. He bought them chips and cola. Then, he held them firmly as the Golden Temple Express approached. The train ran them over, killing them all. Police are investigating the motive. Preeti, Manoj's wife, is left alone. Neighbors are shocked and offer condolences.

title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends Tata Motors, Mphasis, and Hero Motocorp as top stock picks. Nifty is expected to reach 25400/25600, while Bank Nifty aims for 57200/57600.

title: In kharif season, water levels at 2 key Pakistan dams near ‘dead levels'
content: Pakistan faces a growing water crisis as reduced flows from Indian rivers, particularly the Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab, lead to greater discharge than inflow. This situation, exacerbated by India's dam desilting, threatens key agricultural provinces like Punjab and Sindh. With monsoon rains still weeks away and the Indus Water Treaty suspended, Pakistan anticipates significant water shortages for farming.

title: WTC Final: Mitchell Starc surpasses Mohammed Shami during Aus vs SA
content: Mitchell Starc etched his name in history at Lord's, becoming the leading wicket-taker in ICC tournament finals with 11 wickets, surpassing Mohammed Shami. Australia's pace attack, led by Starc, dismantled South Africa, leaving them reeling at 43 for 4 after being bowled out for 212. Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul and a rare statistical anomaly marked a day dominated by bowlers.

title: Census 2027 goes digital; data in 9 months; mobile app to replace paper forms
content: India's Census 2027 aims for a swift data release by late 2027, leveraging digital technology for the first time. Enumerators will use mobile apps in 16 languages, offering citizens a self-enumeration option. This tech-driven approach, including pre-coded responses and intelligent character recognition, promises to significantly reduce processing time compared to previous censuses, with a dedicated portal for management and monitoring.

title: Full India-US trade pact may take time; govt awaits clarity on Trump’s policy
content: India and the US are aiming to finalize an initial trade deal by July 9, but a comprehensive agreement may take longer due to the Trump administration's evolving trade policies. Key issues include tariff implementation, competitiveness for Indian exporters, and protecting sensitive sectors like agriculture.

title: India slips to 131st position in Global Gender Gap Index 2025
content: With a parity score of just 64.1%, India is among the lowest-ranked countries in South Asia, according to the report released on June 12, 2025

title: Woman constable dies, 2 other policemen injured after being hit by speeding car in Patna
content: The deceased constable has been identified as Komal (22), while those injured are Deepak Kumar (sub-inspector) and Awdesh Kumar (assistant sub-inspector).

title: Indian-origin physician Bobby Mukkamala sworn in as American Medical Association president
content: Dr. Bobby Mukkamala became the first physician of Indian heritage to lead the American Medical Association

title: Madras High Court suspends IAS officer Anshul Mishra’s one-month sentence in contempt plea
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan direct the officer to deposit ₹25,000 with the Registrar (Judicial) of the High Court

title: The carving chef: Raju Garu’s rise from kitchens to Telugu TV
content: With over 9000 recipes and a love for natural ingredients, chef Raju Garu has carved out a niche in the world of televised Telugu cuisine

title: Karnataka rains: Man washed away in overflowing drain in Hubballi
content: Hubballi received heavy rains on June 11 evening, which continued past midnight resulting in waterlogging in many localities

title: Tension in Odisha's Bhadrak after man's death in clash over cattle smuggling; internet suspended
content: Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi has announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh and job for one of the family members of the deceased and ordered strict action against the culprits

title: 12 children from childcare homes in Kerala’s Ernakulam join families under vacation foster care program
content: Inquiry officers conduct home study of potential foster family, prepare a social investigation report, and investigate financial and medical backgrounds before allotting children

title: Jyestabhishekam concludes on a religious note at Tirumala
content: The day commenced with Maha Shanti Homam and was followed by Snapana Thirumanjanam at the Kalyanotsava mandapam inside the temple complex.

title: Addressing non-tariff barriers key for India, EU trade pact, says Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce Minister added that both India and the EU are in active discussions to find solutions to make business smooth for companies of both sides.

title: PM Modi lauds India's technological, digital progress in past 11 years
content: ‘Powered by the youth of India, we are making remarkable progress in innovation and application of technology,’ PM Modi said on June 12.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka Leader of Opposition R. Ashok seeks NHRC intervention
content: The NHRC’s intervention through probe is vital not only to secure justice for the affected families, but also to ensure that such incidents do not recur, says Mr. Ashok

title: COVID-19: Isolation beds kept ready in Kalyan-Dombivli civic hospitals in Maharashtra’s Thane
content: Maharashtra reported 107 new COVID-19 cases on June 11, 2025, taking the total of viral infections detected in the State so far this year to 1,700, as per the Public Health Department

title: West Bengal clashes: Police arrests 40 for violence in Maheshtala, says situation ‘under control’
content: 28 persons were arrested by West Bengal police and 12 by Kolkata Police. Seven FIRs have been registered in connection with the violence on Wednesday

title: Legislative Council panel visits Hutti gold mines in Raichur district, suggests improvement in safety measures
content: The visit began with an underground tour of the gold mine, where legislators descended nearly one kilometre to observe the gold extraction process

title: ED arrests ex-Haryana MLA,aide in money laundering case
content: The ED initiated the investigation on the basis of FIR registered at Panchkula by Haryana Police against unknown persons, said the statement.

title: Crowds throng Raichur to witness spectacular bull power contest at Mungaru Habba
content: Vajrala Tejaswi Reddy’s pair of bulls from Santamagaluru village in Nandyal district of Andhra Pradesh, which managed to drag a 2-tonne boulder an impressive 3,913 feet in 20 minutes, claimed the first prize

title: CBI submits fourth status report in R.G. Kar rape and murder case
content: The parents of the victim have on multiple occasions shared their dissatisfaction with CBI probe and said they are dragging their feet

title: Full arrangements to handle COVID situation, says U.P. government
content: Last month, U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath also conducted review of the health department issuing directions to step up preparedness in case of any spike in cases

title: Singapore-flagged ship fire: Coastal surveillance stepped up amid efforts to recover containers that fell into sea
content: Coastal police and marine enforcement squads are part of patrol off Malabar coast for heightened vigil

title: Two dead, one injured after inhaling poisonous gas at JNPC in Anakapalli
content: The incident took place during the night shift on June 11 when the employees were carrying out procedures to treat waste at the Effluent Treatment Plant  before transferring it to the Common ETP.

title: ED raids in Rajasthan, Gujarat in ₹2,700 cr investors 'fraud' case
content: The case filed under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) stems from a Rajasthan Police FIR against a company called Nexa Evergreen.

title: TS TET hall ticket 2025 released: Step-by-step guide to download hall ticket, dates & other details
content: The TS TET 2025 exam, which will be administered by computer-based test (CBT),  will be held from June 18 to June 30, with two shifts each day. Read more details here

title: Assam will deport 'foreigners' even if their names feature in NRC: Himanta
content: “The way the NRC was carried out in Assam leaves a lot of scope for doubt, and it cannot be the only document for determining a person’s citizenship,” the Chief Minister said.

title: Delhi records highest peak power demand on June 11
content: Amid the red alert red issued for Delhi as it remained in the grip of an intense heatwave, the Capital records peak demand of 8,231 MW on June 11.

title: U.S. hyphenating India, Pak; PM must drop 'stubbornness' and call special session of Parliament: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh asserted in a post on X that decades of diplomatic progress cannot be allowed to be weakened so easily.

title: Why has the Axiom-4 mission been delayed? | Explained
content: Ahead of the June 11 flight, SpaceX had tested one of the rocket’s engines as a matter of procedure and discovered it was leaking liquid oxygen

title: Singapore-flagged ship fire: Hydrocarbon release detected near fuel tank of burning vessel
content: According to latest situation report released by government agencies,  Salvage Master observations confirmed ongoing hydrocarbon release, with potential involvement of fuel tanks

title: A different approach to the caste census | Explained
content: What have the Bihar caste survey and Telangana’s 2025 caste survey revealed? How is a social management approach different from top-down welfare models? Would a caste census deepen social divide and undermine national unity? What about democratic accountability?

title: U.P. govt suppressed Maha Kumbh death toll, says Rahul Gandhi, cites BBC report
content: BBC report reveals that figures of deaths in Kumbh Mela stampede were hidden. Like in COVID, the bodies of the poor were erased from the statistics. Like after every major railway accident the truth is suppressed, says Rahul Gandhi

title: A chaotic Mangal Eri Park signal near Ambattur Industrial Estate
content: The traffic lights for three of the four roads may by red, but that does not discourage vehicles coming from those three roads from crossing the junction out of turn

title: Raghuvanshi honeymoon murder: ‘Mangalsutra’ left by Sonam at homestay helps investigators crack Meghalaya case
content: The accused persons have admitted to the crime, and with all the evidence, there is no room to deny, says Meghalaya's Director General of Police (DGP) I Nongrang

title: Vance, Rubio played key roles in India-Pak. deescalation: Trump nominee
content: The U.S. and India share a host of common interests, such as ensuring a free and open Indo-Pacific region, which is not dominated by China, expanding bilateral trade

title: Increase in anti-dumping duty by U.S. on Indian shrimp a cause for concern
content: Andhra Pradesh urges Centre to resolve the issues faced by seafood exporters in India by diplomatically engaging with the shrimp importing countries, particularly the U.S.

title: Consider establishing Civil Aviation University in Visakhapatnam: Naidu
content: The design of the terminal building at the Vijayawada airport should be attractive and unique, he tells officials

title: 21 booked for assaulting, stripping three men over witchcraft allegations in Raipur
content: The First Information Report was registered on June 9 following a lower court order on the incident which happened three months ago

title: Krishnam Raju arrested by Thullur police
content: Guntur police confirmed the arrest; police has been searching for Mr Krishnam Raju since his alleged derogatory remarks about Amaravati region and women during a live TV debate

title: ASBL to launch 50-storey residential project in Hyderabad’s financial district
content: Spread across five acres, Broadway will feature three high-rise towers with G+50 floors, comprising a total of 885 three-bedroom apartments; scheduled for completion by December 2029

title: Plea for express trains halt at Malkajgiri station
content: Infrastructure development worth ₹28 crore is under way at Malkajgiri station, according to a memorandum submitted to Union Minister G. Kishan Reddy

title: OBC quota deadlock dominates politics in West Bengal; new list an appeasement move, says BJP
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee says“backwardness”was the only benchmark to decide OBC category. LOP Suvendu Adhikari claimed that new list being prepared by West Bengal government is aimed at “appeasement politics”.

title: Clashes in Bengal leaves several police personnel injured, vehicles vandalised
content: Several police personnel sustained injuries while trying to control the situation. A number of police vehicles were also set on fire by the mob, which was seen pelting stones at the police

title: Government strengthening IT cells to counter terrorist propaganda on social media: Union Home Secretary
content: Police and other investigating agencies are encouraged to “not hesitate to use strict provisions under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act” in all cases where it is necessary, says Govind Mohan

title: Encroachments demolished on key stretches in Pallikonda for drain work
content: The officials said the drive aims to restore the road’s original width of 40 feet, as the current reduced width of 20 feet has led to frequent accidents at night.

title: No scope for third-party intervention, but India, Pakistan should start diplomatic initiatives: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) leader says military options are limited to deal with terrorism, urges administrative, political, diplomatic initiatives; says restoration of Statehood, Article 370 are key to bringing peace to J&K

title: VCK chief rules out quitting DMK alliance over number of seats in 2026 assembly elections
content: VCK general secretary, D. Ravikumar, said that the DMK should do more to satisfy the demands and expectations of its alliance partners

title: On 11th anniversary, Modi government pitches its work at ‘Amrit generation’ of youth
content: Financial inclusion through Jan Dhan accounts, investments in roads and airports, health insurance, and digital infrastructure projects were listed as among the government’s efforts for the common people, especially the younger generations

title: Residents near Arani hoist black flags against setting up of new Sewage Treatment Plant
content: Panchayat officials said that the proposed plant will be set up on a 1.5-acre plot at the border area of these two villages at a cost of ₹7 crore

title: Airtel cracks down on online fraud in T.N., blocks 1,80,000 malicious links
content: Automatically enabled for all Airtel mobile and broadband customers, the advanced system scans and filters links across SMS, WhatsApp, Telegram, Facebook, Instagram, e-mail, and other browsers

title: Even America cannot control Trump, says Rajyavardhan Rathore
content: The Rajasthan Cabinet Minister was speaking at an event in Bikaner organised to mark 11 years of the BJP government at the Centre

title: Kanchi Acharya releases Tamil translation of books published by The Hindu Group on Mahaswamigal
content: Sri Shankara Vijayendra Saraswati says the book details Mahaswamigal’s life, spiritual journeys, public discourses, teachings, and the widespread reception he received, which were compiled from news reports and photographs published in The Hindu

title: SPC transfers boutique cash fraud case to Crime Branch
content: Police stat that the case requires a detailed and protracted investigation, given the financial angle and accusations of extrajudicial questioning, alleged caste slurs, and condemnatory statements on social media

title: Only sanitary workers must be shareholders of a group management company aimed at transforming them into sanipreneurs, orders Madras High Court
content: Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan also direct CMWSSB to revise the list of 213 beneficiaries within six weeks

title: Centre trying to kill MGNREGS, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: He shares media report on government capping spending for the rural employment scheme at 60% of its allocation to target the government on the issue

title: Railways suspends four officials for sending unsuitable train to transport BSF personnel from Tripura to J&K
content: A BSF personnel had posted several videos on social media, which showed the train in a precarious condition

title: Airtel blocks 1,80,000 malicious links across Karnataka
content: Airtel’s solution would act as a State-wide digital shield, protecting families, senior citizens, homemakers, students and first-time smartphone users alike

title: ‘Polluting’ plant in an eco-sensitive zone in Uttarkashi draws public ire
content: Set up to dispose of solid waste from increasing tourism, the unit has not been given necessary approvals, according to an Uttarakhand PCB official; eco-sensitive zone monitoring committee divided

title: Newly constituted Special Bench to hear petitions against Maratha reservation afresh from July 18
content: The previous Full Bench could not hear the matter completely as the then Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court, part of the Bench, was transferred to Delhi

title: Tourist rush due to heatwave, summer holidays choking hills of Nainital
content: To control the situation, the police are giving priority to tourists with prior hotel bookings and encouraging visitors to use shuttle bus services from parking lots instead of bringing their cars to the hills.

title: Congress leaders unite at Rajesh Pilot memorial event in Rajasthan
content: Sachin Pilot’s show of strength in Dausa on father’s 25th death anniversary, Gehlot’s presence signals possible rapprochement

title: Pacers ride Mathurin, bench to Game 3 victory
content: Bennedict Mathurin scored 27 points, leading a Pacers unit that enjoyed a whopping 49-18 edge in bench points, and Indiana reclaimed the lead in the NBA Finals by beating Oklahoma City 116-107 in Game 3 on Wednesday night.

title: OKC points to 'unforced errors' amid unraveling
content: The Thunder were outscored 32-18 in the fourth quarter Wednesday night as they lost to the Pacers in Game 3 of the NBA Finals.

title: Wilson exits with head injury as Aces fall to Sparks
content: Aces star A'ja Wilson will be reevaluated Thursday after departing in the third quarter of Wednesday's 94-84 loss to the Sparks with what the team said was a head injury.

title: Run-heavy Steelers aim for balance with Rodgers
content: Steelers offensive coordinator Arthur Smith said he hopes last year's run-heavy offense can transition into more of a run-pass balance under new quarterback Aaron Rodgers.

title: Bueckers hot in return, explodes for 35 in loss
content: Back after missing four games, Paige Bueckers made her first six shots and finished with 35 points Wednesday night in a 93-80 loss to the Mercury.

title: Dobbins defends claim father played for Yankees
content: Red Sox rookie Hunter Dobbins said there is nothing nefarious about the connections he said his father had to the Yankees despite a report saying the claims were nefarious.

title: Twins' Buxton exults in 479-foot 'big boy' homer
content: The Twins' Byron Buxton put on a "mesmerizing" display Wednesday night, laucnhing the second-longest homer in the majors this season and making a diving catch in center field.

title: 🤝 Five Kevin Durant trade proposals
content: With the Suns and Durant meeting to sift through trade destinations, our NBA insiders break down five deals that work -- and pick a winner in the potential KD sweepstakes.

title: U.S. Open storylines: Scheffler's dominance, DeChambeau's chances and how hard Oakmont will play
content: Is it Scottie Scheffler vs. the field this week? Could Oakmont produce an over-par winner? We look at five storylines to watch this week.

title: The return of Javy Baez: How Detroit's $140 million man went from nearly off the roster to thriving
content: Months after hitting rock bottom, the Tigers' highest-paid player has rediscovered himself -- in a new role.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: 32 looming questions under center: What every NFL team still needs to answer about its QB situation
content: Will Philly's coordinator swap impact Jalen Hurts? Are Patrick Mahomes and Jayden Daniels headed for big years? Could Lamar Jackson get another big payday?

title: NFL minicamp updates: Christian McCaffrey feels good again, Jets get Justin Fields experience
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: 'Hard work does pay off': At 17, Mason Howell is the youngest player in the U.S. Open field
content: Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

title: Our latest NBA mock draft: Back-and-forth on team need vs. best value
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: 'Built for this time of year': How Sam Bennett transformed into a playoff MVP candidate
content: One shift in Game 3 encapsulated everything that the veteran center can do on the ice. Here's how he got here.

title: Whose NHL draft stock rose, declined at the scouting combine?
content: The annual event took place this past week in Buffalo -- with major repercussions for the draft on June 27-28.

title: All you need to know one year out from the 2026 World Cup
content: It's Messi and Ronaldo's last dance, and new stars will be born. Just how far can the U.S. go? The big talking points 12 months out from the World Cup.

title: Can Amtrak's busy Northeast Corridor handle the 2026 World Cup?
content: The congested stretch from Boston to Washington is already beleaguered by breakdowns and spotty service.

title: Tuchel: My mom finds Bellingham rage 'repulsive'
content: England manager Thomas Tuchel has said he understands criticism of Jude Bellingham after the midfielder's emotions boiled over during the shock defeat to Senegal on Tuesday.

title: Sporting demand more than $80M for Gyökeres
content: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres will not be available for €70 million ($80m) this summer, the club's president has warned amid interest from Manchester United.

title: Miami owner 'fully expects' MLS calendar shift
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said he expects MLS will soon agree to align with the international soccer calendar.

title: Gold Cup monitoring L.A. protests before opener
content: Concacaf said on Wednesday it was in "close and ongoing communication" with local officials as protests in Los Angeles continue ahead of the Gold Cup's opening match at SoFi Stadium.

title: Grealish left out of Man City Club World Cup squad
content: Jack Grealish has been left out of Manchester City's 28-man squad for the Club World Cup, the Premier League side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Sources: Coffey has Thorns extension through '27
content: USWNT midfielder Sam Coffey signed a contract extension with the Portland Thorns last year to tie her to the NWSL club through the 2027 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Inter Miami's key to Club World Cup success? Rest Messi in MLS
content: Lionel Messi is perhaps the greatest soccer player of all time, but his MLS team Inter Miami tends to reserve him for the bigger games and competitions -- like this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Wetzel: It's new rules, same old game in NCAA athlete pay
content: College athletics is back in the rules business now that schools can directly pay players, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: Biggest surprise, head-scratcher and more from the transfer cycle
content: Which teams improved -- or hurt -- their outlook? We award winners and losers of this offseason's cycle.

title: Rankings: Janelle Salaun makes her debut
content: Janelle Salaun makes her first appearance in the fantasy women's basketball rankings while Jewell Loyd and Aliyah Boston might not be on the decline for long.

title: Hot potato! Get rid of these impostors before it's too late
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at the current stats and passes judgment on which hot players need to go.

title: In Honeymoon Murder Case, "Sonam Married Raja To...": What His Family Said
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi's mother should also be probed in connection with Raja's murder in Meghalaya last month, his brother said.

title: Social Media Influencer Found Dead In Car Inside Punjab University
content: The body of a social media influencer was discovered in a car in the parking lot of a Punjab-based university.

title: Canada's Project Pelican: 7 Indian-Origin Men Held For Smuggling Cocaine Worth $48 Million
content: Nine people, including seven Indian-origin men, have been arrested in Canada's Ontario over the alleged smuggling of cocaine and possession of arms.

title: 33% Women's Reservation In 2029 Lok Sabha Elections? Centre Begins Preps
content: The Centre is preparing to implement 33 per cent reservation for women in the Lok Sabha beginning with the 2029 general elections.

title: Photo Of 4 Raja Raghuvanshi Murder Accused In Police Custody Surfaces
content: Raj Kushwaha, Akash Rajput, Vishal Singh Chauha and Anand Kurmi - these are the four men who helped Sonam Raghuvanshi kill her husband, Raja, in Meghalaya last month, days after their wedding in Madhya Pradesh.

title: India Drop's In Global Gender Gap Report, Now Ranks...
content: India has ranked 131 out of 146 countries in the World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report 2025, slipping two places from its position last year, With a parity score of just 64.1 per cent.

title: "India's Youth Powering A Digital Revolution", PM Modi Applauds
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has lauded India's young innovators for their pivotal role in advancing technology and driving the nation's self-reliance, highlighting 11 years of digital India.

title: Mango Politics In South: Karnataka Asks Andhra To Revoke 'Totapuri' Ban
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah expressed "deep concern" over the ban, calling it an "abrupt and unilateral move" that has severely impacted mango farmers in Karnataka's border regions.

title: Heavy Rain Hits Karnataka, Red Alert Issued In Multiple Districts
content: The North of Karnataka continues to reel under the onslaught of relentless monsoon rains, with districts like Hubbali-Dharwad, Gadag, and parts of Haveri among the worst affected.

title: How Did Raja Raghuvanshi, Sonam Meet Before Marriage? What Family Told NDTV
content: Raja Raghuvanshi and Sonam's families were not familiar with one another and met through a matrimonial app while seeking partners for their children, the former's cousin, Arpit, has said.

title: "Can't Force You To...": Bangladesh's Yunus' Sheikh Hasina Chat With PM Modi
content: Bangladesh's interim leader, Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus, issued a rebuke of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's public statements from Indian soil, claiming that he personally urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene.

title: Islam Fastest-Growing In World, Christianity 2nd, 'Nones' 3rd Largest: Pew Report
content: The Pew's 'Global Religious Landscape' report, published on June 9, reveals how population growth has influenced the global religious landscape.

title: Woman Constable Among 3 Cops Injured After Hit By Speeding Car In Patna
content: Three security personnel, including a woman constable, were injured in an accident involving a speeding car near Patna, police said on Thursday.

title: No Plan To Levy Merchant Discount Rate On UPI Transactions: Finance Ministry
content: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday said that "speculation and claims that the MDR (merchant discount rate) will be charged on UPI transactions are completely false, baseless, and misleading".

title: Delhi Records Highest Peak Power Demand Of This Summer On June 11
content: Amid soaring temperatures, Delhi recorded its highest peak power demand of this summer on June 11. The real-time figures of the State Load Dispatch Centre (SLDC) showed the peak demand was 8,231 MW at 10.55 pm.

title: 'Flying Buses' For Bengaluru's Traffic Chaos? What Nitin Gadkari Told NDTV
content: India is evaluating new modes of futuristic transport, including elevated airpod-based systems and flash-charging electric buses, to tackle traffic congestion and reduce pollution in metro cities, Nitin Gadkari told NDTV.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids In Rajasthan, Gujarat In Rs 2,700 Crore Fraud Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday conducted searches in Rajasthan and Gujarat as part of a money laundering investigation into an alleged Rs 2,700 crore fraud with investors, official sources said.

title: Trump Said He "Could" Forgive Musk In An Interview, Before X Boss Apologised
content: US President Donald Trump said in an interview recorded on Monday, for podcast Pod Force One, that he "could" fix the relationship with billionaire Elon Musk.

title: Indore Man Kills Grandmother, 65, For Money, Hides Body In Bed: Cops
content: A 28 year old man in Indore allegedly strangled his 65-year-old grandmother who later hid her body in a bed storage box. He has been arrested within hours of the crime after he attempted to flee to Rajasthan.

title: 5 Injured After Mob Clashes With Cops Near Kolkata, BJP Seeks Central Forces
content: Tension simmered in the Rabindranagar area near Kolkata on Wednesday as a violent clash between two groups spiralled into widespread unrest, leaving several police personnel injured and multiple vehicles vandalised.
